original: Bonde, Tom Paul Berthil, landsfiskal, Slite, f. 3/8/03 i Kalmar av guldsmeden Claes B. o. Hanna Sofia Jonsson. G. 34 m. farm. kand. Alfhild Almgren. Barn: Ingrid f. 37. — Re-alex. 19, landsfiskalsex. 27. Värnpl. löjtn. v. Gotl. inf:reg. Res. t. Tyskl. 32, Tyskl., HolL, Belg. o. Frankr. 36. Bitr. o. tf. landsfiskal inom Kalmar 1. 24-33, landsfiskal i Shte sed 33. Ordf. inom Slite köpings m. fl. tax:-ndr, ordf. i Slite skyttegille o. N. Gotl. nationalbeväring, led. av styr. f. Gotl. 1. skytteförb., ordf. i Slite köpings hälsov:nd sed. 36, v. ordf. i byggn:-ndn, ordf. i styr. f. Slite komm. mel-lansk., led. av komm:fullm. sed. 38. Hobbies: skytte, skogsvård. Gotl. skytteförb. förtj :M 37, SvRK förtj:-plak. i silver 45.
translated: Bonde, Tom Paul Berthil, district prosecutor, Slite, b. 3/8/03 in Kalmar to goldsmith Claes B. and Hanna Sofia Jonsson. Married in 1934 to agricultural candidate Alfhild Almgren. Children: Ingrid b. 1937. Completed realexamen in 1919 and became a district prosecutor in 1927. Served as a lieutenant in the Gotland Infantry Regiment during conscription. Went on reserve duty to Germany in 1932 and served in Germany, Holland, Belgium, and France in 1936. Served as an assistant and acting district prosecutor in Kalmar from 1924-1933 before becoming a district prosecutor in Shte in 1933. Served as the chair of the Slite municipality's tax commission and other commissions, chair of the Slite shooting society and Gotland's national reserve forces, and was a member of the board of Gotland's shooting association. Chair of Slite municipality's health commission since 1936, vice chair of the building commission, chair of the board of Slite's intermediate municipality, and member of the municipal council since 1938. Hobbies: shooting and forestry. Received the Gotland Shooting Association's merit medal in 1937 and the Swedish Red Cross's merit plaque in silver in 1945.

structured.name: Tom Paul Berthil Bonde
structured.description: Tom Paul Berthil Bonde was a Swedish district prosecutor and active in various organizations, including the Slite Municipality, the Gotland Shooting Association, and the Swedish Red Cross. He was born on August 3, 1903, in Kalmar, to goldsmith Claes B. Bonde and Hanna Sofia Jonsson. He married agricultural candidate Alfhild Almgren in 1934 and had one child, Ingrid, in 1937. Bonde completed his realexamen in 1919 and became a district prosecutor in 1927. He served as a lieutenant in the Gotland Infantry Regiment during conscription and went on reserve duty to Germany in 1932, serving in Germany, Holland, Belgium, and France in 1936. He served as an assistant and acting district prosecutor in Kalmar from 1924-1933 before becoming a district prosecutor in Shte in 1933. Bonde had a number of hobbies, including shooting and forestry.
